meanings.definition: A genre of rabbinic literature that includes non-legalistic narratives, parables, and legends.
meanings.sent1: The children enjoyed listening to the aggadah during story time at the synagogue.
meanings.sent2: The rabbi shared an interesting aggadah about kindness and compassion.
meanings.sent3: The aggadah about the talking animals made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her storytelling was like an aggadah weaving through the minds of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The colorful illustrations in the aggadah made the tales come alive.

meanings.definition: The non-legalistic teachings and stories found in the Talmud and other Jewish texts.
meanings.sent1: During the lesson, the students discussed the meaning of the aggadah in the text.

meanings.sent4: Her wisdom flowed like an aggadah, captivating all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The aggadah painted vivid pictures of ancient times in the listeners' minds.
